caseTitle: Federation of Pakistan through the Secretary, Ministry of Law & Justice Islamabad v. The Honourable Supreme Judicial Council through its Secretary, Supreme Court Building, Islamabad and others
authorJudge: Mr. Justice Syed Hasan Azhar Rizvi
tagline: Dissenting Note: (i) A judge, after retirement or resignation, cannot be termed 'a judge of the Supreme Court or a High Court' within the purview of Article 209(5) of the Constitution, and as such, the SJC lacks authority to conduct an inquiry against him. (ii) The Constitution is not a procedural law where everything that is not prohibited is permissible. (iii) If a provision of law is misused and subjected to the abuse of the legal process, it is for the legislature to amend, modify, or repeal it if deemed necessary.
